meanings.definition: Covered or smeared with dirt or grime
meanings.sent1: The filthy floor made my shoes dirty.
meanings.sent2: She refused to enter the filthy restroom.
meanings.sent3: The filthy dog happily rolled in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The filthy windows obscured the view outside.
meanings.sent5: The filthy dishes in the sink attracted flies.

meanings.sent1: His filthy lies hurt many people.
meanings.sent2: The criminal had a filthy conscience.
meanings.sent3: The filthy act left a stain on his soul.
meanings.sent4: Her filthy thoughts consumed her mind.
meanings.sent5: The filthy deed weighed heavily on his heart.

meanings.sent1: The filthy smell coming from the dumpster was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The movie had a filthy scene that made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: His filthy jokes always made people cringe.
meanings.sent4: The filthy language used in the argument was unnecessary.
meanings.sent5: The filthy behavior of the guests shocked the host.
